citations.narrative:
The facility does not have up-to-date records of acquisition, animals on hand and disposition of animals at the facility. The
records, for example, do not contain the disposition records for a Patas monkey, a Spider monkey, 2 Fennec foxes, 1 of 5
camels and 2 of 4 zebras. The animals on hand did not match the number and types of animals present at inspection. The
record of animals on hand, with full acquisition and disposition records, are important to assure that all animals are
located during an emergency of natural disaster, particularly if facility representatives with a working knowledge of the
inventory is not available. These records are also reviewed by APHIS officials to assure that animals are obtained from
appropriate sources and as a measure to assure appropriate animal care.
These records must be updated routinely and maintained in the future to reflect animal arrivals, animals on hand and
departures from the facility.
Corrected by 15-Nov-2023

During the inspection, 5 goats were observed walking outside of their outdoor enclosure. According to the licensee, the
animal had escaped from their primary enclosure. There were no injuries to the animal. Failure to maintain housing
facilities, so that they contain the animals securely, increases the risk of injury to the animals. The licensee must ensure
that the housing facilities for animals are designed and constructed so that they can always contain the animals securely.
In addition, the licensee must also ensure that the housing facilities are structurally sound, kept in good repair, they must
protect the animals from injury, and restrict other animals from entering the enclosure.
Corrected by 15-Nov-2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility does not have up-to-date records of acquisition, animals on hand and disposition of animals at the facility. The 
records, for example, do not contain the disposition records for a Patas monkey, a Spider monkey, 2 Fennec foxes, 1 of 5 
camels and 2 of 4 zebras. The animals on hand did not match the number and types of animals present at inspection. The 
record of animals on hand, with full acquisition and disposition records, are important to assure that all animals are 
located during an emergency of natural disaster, particularly if facility representatives with a working knowledge of the 
inventory is not available. These records are also reviewed by APHIS officials to assure that animals are obtained from 
appropriate sources and as a measure to assure appropriate animal care. 
These records must be updated routinely and maintained in the future to reflect animal arrivals, animals on hand and 
departures from the facility.  
Corrected by 15-Nov-2023 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
During the inspection, 5 goats were observed walking outside of their outdoor enclosure. According to the licensee, the 
animal had escaped from their primary enclosure. There were no injuries to the animal. Failure to maintain housing 
facilities, so that they contain the animals securely, increases the risk of injury to the animals. The licensee must ensure 
that the housing facilities for animals are designed and constructed so that they can always contain the animals securely. 
In addition, the licensee must also ensure that the housing facilities are structurally sound, kept in good repair, they must 
protect the animals from injury, and restrict other animals from entering the enclosure.  
Corrected by 15-Nov-2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
